name: electricity production, cobalt industry | electricity, high voltage, cobalt industry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22891/documentation

The purpose of this dataset is to model the electricity mix that is used by the cobalt industry. The production volume represents the total amount of electricity that is produced for the cobalt industry. Note: Large proportion of Apline hydropower is due to limited availablity of country-specific electricity emission factors at the time the cobalt industry was first assessed (2012) and has been maintained in order to be consistent with the reference sources ("The Environmental Performance of Refined Cobalt - Life Cycle Inventory and Life Cycle Assessment of Refined Cobalt - Summary Report", CDI & ERM, Novermber 2016.). Future iterations will improve this.;Details on the electricity generation with each technology can be found in the datasets that supply the inputs to this dataset.

This dataset does not represent a real transformation activity. Conceptually, the activity can be said to start with the production of electricity.

This dataset does not represent a real transformation activity. Conceptually, the activity can be said to end with a given amount of high voltage electricity that is supplied specifically to the cobalt industry.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Grid electricity for each country where electricity use is reported was represented by datasets from ecoinvent (v3.1). Where country-specific datasets for electricity generation were not available in ecoinvent, national or regional grid electricity was modelled based on power generation by fuel type from ecoinvent (v3.1) and national statistics on electricity mixes from the International Energy Agency (IEA 2011).

exchanges.description: Value obtained from the industry. The amount reflects the split of electricity generating technologies seen in the geographic regions covered by the sample, relative to the amount of cobalt metal produced in the regions included in the sample.
